content: color a in 1st double_crochet don t fasten_off color b for details see fig 3 round 4 with color a chain 1 doesn t count as a stitch single_crochet in same stitch as slip_stitch single_crochet in next stitch * fptc around double_crochet of round 2 skip 1 stitch single_crochet in next 2 stitches * repeat from * to * around the fptc are worked around every 2nd double_crochet of round 2 32 single_crochet 16 fptc = 48 stitches join color b with 2 last loops of last stitch close round with slip_stitch in color b don t fasten_off color a for details see fig 4 round 5 with color b chain 1 doesn t count as a stitch * fpdc around next double_crochet of round 3 2 times these are the both visible - not covered by the fptc of previous round - dcs single_crochet on fptc of previous round * repeat from * to * around 32 fpdc 16 single_crochet = 48 stitches close round with slip_stitch in first fpdc for details see fig 5 round 6 with color b chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in next stitch * 2 double_crochet in next stitch which is the single_crochet of prev round 1 double_crochet in next 2 stitches * one increase in every 3rd stitch worked on the single_crochet of prev round repeat from * to * around 64 stitches join color a with last 2 loops of last stitch close round with slip_stitch in color a round 7 with color a chain 1 crab stitch in next stitch crab stitch in every stitch of prev round last crab stitch in chain of beginning of round for the hanger of the dishcloth turn work slip_stitch in next stitch to the left chain 15 slip_stitch in same stitch fasten_off both colors weave in ends and cut off ends that you have crocheted in hint while changing the colors you will get floats of the yarn you pulled up especially after round 6 if you don t like these floats you can reduce them by using some tips tip 1 very easy while weaving in the end-tail of color b after round 6 stitch over the float of color a that fixes the float and makes it less obvious tip 2 more advanced - at the ends of rnds 3 and 6 on last double_crochet of round yarn over with color b insert hook in stitch as usual yarn over with color a then yarn over with color b again and pull color b through the stitch this catches color a at the bottom of stitch on back side not showing on the front yarn over with color b and pull through 2 loops yarn over with color a and pull through last two loops on hook continue as indicated in the instructions sunburst_rounds_dishcloth_coaster_en_v05 2021-12-06 page 2 of 3 detailed pictures from completed rounds 3 4 and 5 fig 3 - round 3 completed ready to join color a fig
